answers.answer: HiNumbness in the toes can be due to a lot of causes like a diabetes, hypothyroidism, arthritis, disc herniation, arteriovenous malformation, effect of some medication, peripheral neuropathy, stroke, hemorrhage, tumor, cervical spine disorder, injury, lyme disease, etc. Disc herniations can cause neurological symptoms such as numbness, back pain, leg pain, tingling, weakness etc in the limbs. It is important to know the site of the disc herniations and the type of symptoms that you are experiencing.Do you have any history of injury, raised cholesterol, raised BP, diabetes, cervical spondylosis or any other medical problems? Since you are experiencing the symptoms for a long time, it may perhaps be due to some medical disorder.I would advise that you should consult a neurologist with your past medical and neurological examination and tests like CT scan, MRI or lumbar puncture, as appropriate, would be able to diagnose your condition. You should take rest and avoid lifting any weights for the next few days.Do write in if you need some other information.Take care!
I told the nurologist about it he didnt say anything.  I had a ct and mri scan of the head.  I have hight bp but its under control with meds none of the other things.

question: For most of my adult life i have had numbness in my toes but since my loss of muscles last month it is way worse. Does anyone know why and what i can do for it?Taybey
title: Numb Toes
